com.codemelon.graph.algorithm.spanningtree

Class Prim<E extends SpanningTreeEdgeData,U extends EdgeDataFactory<E>,V extends UndirectedPrimVertex<E,U>,T extends VertexFactory<V>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codemelon.graph.algorithm.spanningtree.Prim<E,U,V,T>

  • public class Prim<E extends SpanningTreeEdgeData,U extends EdgeDataFactory<E>,V extends UndirectedPrimVertex<E,U>,T extends VertexFactory<V>>
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of Kruskal's algorithm for growing a minimum spanning tree. Follows CLRS, pp. 634ff. In this implementation, the markEdges() method does 2 things:
    1. Marks the edges belonging to the minimum spanning tree as BLACK and all other edges WHITE, and
    2. Specifies the parents of all vertices so that the specified root vertex is the root node in the minimum spanning tree marked by BLACK edges.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void markEdges(V root)
      Set edges in minimum spanning tree to BLACK, all other edges are set to WHITE.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Prim

        public Prim(UndirectedWeightedEdgeGraph<E,U,V> graph)

    • Method Detail

      • markEdges

        public void markEdges(V root)
        Set edges in minimum spanning tree to BLACK, all other edges are set to WHITE. Parents of all vertices in the graph are also modified to show a path leading back to the specified root.
        Parameters:
        root - source vertex for minimum spanning tree
